Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 11:02 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Roynon Close area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground cables, which our engineers have now diverted power around the fault.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Roynon Close area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Roland at 10:40.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, Roland here. I understand that having a power cut over Christmas Day is especially difficult, as you may have celebrations planned which will be impacted by the lights going out. 

I wanted to reassure you that our office and field staff work 365 days a year to ensure that power cuts are fixed, and that you always have someone to speak to. Our engineers will restore your power as quickly as they can, and my team will update you with all of their progress.

If you have any concerns or want to speak to us about anything, call us any time on 08003163105 and press the option for power cuts.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 02:12 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 380 customers in the BN7 3 area to safely investigate a downed overhead cable.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Luke at 01:49 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 00:50 - Our engineers are on their way to investigate. Originally, we believed this issue to be a fault on our network, but we have been made aware that due to a downed overhead cable, our engineers have had to turn power off remotely in the interest of public safety.

We'll let you know once engineers get to site, and we'll turn your power back on once they have investigated and confirmed the area is safe.

We'll continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 00:03. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 01:50 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 161 customers in the Deal and Dover area, by diverting power around the fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 01:21 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead fault affecting 161 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 04:00 and 05:00. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 04:28. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:52 - Hi David here again.  I'm sorry for how long power was affected especially on Christmas Day. We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 275 customers in the RH5 5 area, by removing the trees that were laying on the overhead cables This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:03 - Hi David here again. I apologies for how long you've been without power especially on Christmas Day. I just wanted to give you the latest update. Our engineers are still on site in the Dorking, RH5 5 area working with the tree cutters to remove a large amount of trees that have fallen onto our overhead electrical cables. Once these are removed the engineers will work on repairs to the cables and restore your power. At the moment we don't need to change the estimated timeframe.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 09:07 - Hi David here again. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue works on the overhead network thats has been damaged by a tree falling onto it in the Street area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, David from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, David here again. I understand that having a power cut on Christmas Day is especially difficult, as you may have celebrations planned which will be impacted by the lights going out. 

I wanted to reassure you that our office and field staff work 365 days a year to ensure that power cuts are fixed, and that you always have someone to speak to. Our engineers will restore your power as quickly as they can, and my team will update you with all of their progress.

If you have any concerns or want to speak to us about anything, call us any time on 08003163105 and press the option for power cuts.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

At the moment, we don't need to change the time frame and we'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Roland from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 12:26 - Our engineers are still on site working on repairs. To ensure we get the remaining properties restored, so we have decided to also send temporary generators to site to provide power. We'll let you know when they arrive on site. The estimated timeframe hasn't changed. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://bit.ly/40quttu. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 10:26 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Darsley Drive SW8 2 area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today, especially on Christmas Day.
This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Darsley Drive SW8 2 area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame to restore power is between 13:30-14:30, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Decasta at 10:06.

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Adam, Aaron, Will and Lisa are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 13:14 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi David here again. We're sorry your power has gone off again today. We believed all power was restored but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Our engineers are still on site and are still estimating to have power restored between 16:30-17;30. Sent by David at 12:50.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:38 - Hi David here again from the messaging team. We can now confirm that all power in the Queens Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by a fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We're very sorry for the disruption, especially on Christmas Day.

If your power isn't on, or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 12:18

We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:14 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is faulty underground electrical equipment affecting approximately 227 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 15:00 and 16:00. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.

We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team
